summary.para: Modifies the behavior of a distribution registered with the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

param.name: distributionName
param.para: Unique name representing a distribution (for example, "Fabrikam.Distro.10.01").

param.name: defaultUID
param.para: The Linux user ID to use when launching new WSL sessions for this distribution.

param.name: wslDistributionFlags
param.para: Flags specifying what behavior to use for this distribution.

returns.para: Returns S_OK on success, or a failing HRESULT otherwise.

summary.para: Retrieves the current configuration of a distribution registered with the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

param.name: distributionName
param.para: Unique name representing a distribution (for example, "Fabrikam.Distro.10.01").

param.name: distributionVersion
param.para: The version of WSL for which this distribution is configured.

param.name: defaultUID
param.para: The default user ID used when launching new WSL sessions for this distribution.

param.name: wslDistributionFlags
param.para: The flags governing the behavior of this distribution.

param.name: defaultEnvironmentVariables
param.para: The address of a pointer to an array of default environment variable strings used when launching new WSL sessions for this distribution.

param.name: defaultEnvironmentVariableCount
param.para: The number of elements in pDefaultEnvironmentVariablesArray.

returns.para: Returns S_OK on success, or a failing HRESULT otherwise.

remarks.para: The caller is responsible for freeing each string in pDefaultEnvironmentVariablesArray (and the array itself) via CoTaskMemFree.

summary.para: Determines if a distribution is registered with the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

param.name: distributionName
param.para: Unique name representing a distribution (for example, "Fabrikam.Distro.10.01").

returns.para: Returns TRUE if the supplied distribution is currently registered, or FALSE otherwise.

summary.para: Launches a Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) process in the context of a particular distribution.

param.name: distributionName
param.para: Unique name representing a distribution (for example, "Fabrikam.Distro.10.01").

param.name: command
param.para: Command to execute. If no command is supplied, launches the default shell.

param.name: useCurrentWorkingDirectory
param.para: Governs whether or not the launched process should inherit the calling process's working directory. If FALSE, the process is started in the WSL default user's home directory ("~").

param.name: stdIn
param.para: Handle to use for STDIN.

param.name: stdOut
param.para: Handle to use for STDOUT.

param.name: stdErr
param.para: Handle to use for STDERR.

param.name: process
param.para: Pointer to address to receive the process HANDLE associated with the newly-launched WSL process.

returns.para: Returns S_OK on success, or a failing HRESULT otherwise.

remarks.para: Caller is responsible for calling CloseHandle on the value returned in phProcess on success.

summary.para: Launches an interactive Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) process in the context of a particular distribution.This differs from WslLaunch in that the end user will be able to interact with the newly-created process.

param.name: distributionName
param.para: Unique name representing a distribution (for example, "Fabrikam.Distro.10.01").

param.name: command
param.para: Command to execute. If no command is supplied, launches the default shell.

param.name: useCurrentWorkingDirectory
param.para: Governs whether or not the launched process should inherit the calling process's working directory. If FALSE, the process is started in the WSL default user's home directory ("~").

param.name: exitCode
param.para: Receives the exit code of the process after it exits.

returns.para: Returns S_OK on success, or a failing HRESULT otherwise.

summary.para: Registers a new distribution with the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

param.name: distributionName
param.para: Unique name representing a distribution (for example, "Fabrikam.Distro.10.01").

param.name: tarGzFilename
param.para: Full path to a .tar.gz file containing the file system of the distribution to register.

returns.para: This function can return one of the following values. Use the SUCCEEDED and FAILED macros to test the return value of this function.

item.description: Distribution successfully registered with the Windows Subsystem for Linux.
Failed because a distribution with this name has already been registered.

summary.para: Unregisters a distribution from the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

param.name: distributionName
param.para: Unique name representing a distribution (for example, "Fabrikam.Distro.10.01").

returns.para: Returns S_OK on success, or a failing HRESULT otherwise.
